website_summaries.verdict: Beginners on the electric violin will get a lot out of this budget-friendly model.
pros: Includes a soft-sided case, bow, and rosin
Comes in several finishes and colors
A great practice violin, especially if you don't want to bother other people
cons: Headphones that come with this violin are not the best quality

customer_reviews.title: Having so much fun
customer_reviews.text: I have no clue what it should sound like, I am a beginner and while you can still hear this with the headphones on its pretty quiet, I have not one complaint. Very Happy! ( other than the shipper left it two doors down! Thank goodness I have decent neighbors who notified me they received and opened my box by accident! Amazon delivery shame on you, This purchase could have ended very badly! But..it didn't, my neighbors rock and gave me my package that contained 2 instruments! Almost 300.00 worth of merchandise!)
customer_reviews.author: Kitena Suttles

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: I liked the violin. I think it works well. The headphone is the only thing that is good quality. The sound is really low, but it works. You can see that is a cheap headphone, but it works. You can easily plug in any headphone that you may have. Everything else seems to be of very good quality. The violin is not as silent as I thought. I wish it would be like an electronic piano where you just plug in your headphones and no one can hear anything. You can hear what you are playing perfectly without the headphones. The sound is more beautiful with the headphones. But compared to an acoustic violin the sound is much lower.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: This is amazing! Great for people who live in an apartment and don't want to annoy the neighbors.
customer_reviews.text: Wow! $129 for an electric violin that works! It sounds pretty good through an amp. I was sold after watching this video YouTube [...] and the violin didn't disappoint. I'm just learning to play the violin and this is perfect for practicing in my apartment without annoying my neighbors (although you can still hear without the amp, enough to possibly be annoying). On mine, the stereo output doesn't work very well. It cuts out periodically and it's not really stereo (just one channel). However, I'm still over the moon about it!
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Jewett

customer_reviews.title: ... months so I'm still a beginner but I'm very pleased with the violin
customer_reviews.text: I have only been playing violin for 8 months so I'm still a beginner but I'm very pleased with the violin. This is my first electric violin but it was simple enough to figure out and get the hang of. Just be aware that you are paying for the violin itself. The accessories that come with it are very cheap. The case and bow broke almost immediately and the rosin and headphones are not much better. Once these little things were replaced everything worked great. The violin itself is unbeatable for the price.
customer_reviews.author: A. Rhoads

customer_reviews.title: Great instument low price
customer_reviews.text: I have to start out with this is a great electric violin especially for the price that you are paying. It comes with a decent case that has room for the violin and bow but does not leave much room for a chin rest in the case. The headphone that came with this should be thrown in the trash upon receiving, but we had may pairs of good headphones around the house that we use now. It also comes with a cable to connect the violin to a external amplifier (we connected to guitar amp for some fun effects). I would definitely recommend this violin to someone that is looking to make a change from acoustic to electric.
customer_reviews.author: J. S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice instrument.  Bad assessories.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Wish it came with better strings. They are literally terrible. Why make such a great product and then throw in bad strings....and don't even get me started on the ridiculous things they call headphones. The violin is amazing. Very quiet...not silent at all. Case is good and bow is average. Rosin..bad, headphones are horrible, strings are metal (might as well use them to hang a picture or other use of metal because that's about what they are good for). Love the feature of changing the tone and volume as well as hooking up my own headphones to listen.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Vega

customer_reviews.title: Great for left hand practice
customer_reviews.text: Nut and fingerboard carved properly for consistent fingering. I can use this violin to practice left hand technique and return to my main violin with no problem. It looks like you can gut this instrument of its electronics if you only care about using this for silent practice and want to reduce weight. Edit: knocked two stars off of the original give after noticing double stops on the A and E strings are rather awkward due to there being more distance between the E and A strings on the nuts than the other strings. Will probably end up returning.
customer_reviews.author: Joon Lee

customer_reviews.title: Save your money you can find better quality for equal or less money
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality. The finish is terrible, color is not even, the strings are cheap. Overall, the violin and bow are flimsy and it is simply inaccurate to use the word "craftsmanship," it is cheap mass production. You get less value than the money paid. Very irritated and disappointed. I will follow up when I locate a better quality item for equal or less money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase, two weeks old
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my electric Cecilio violin a few weeks ago to learn how to play, and love it. I haven't had it long, but have been practicing 2-3 hours per day and so far have not had any problems. The violin (black) is beautiful, appears to be well-made, and arrived as advertised. Not sure what brand of strings it comes with but the G&D are decent; A&E are pretty rough. Give the strings a few days to stretch - they will stay in tune eventually! Buy better ones when you can. Cecilio seems to be a fairly reputable company from the videos I've seen. I purchased with the "fretless finger guide" and it fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy with this good quality instrument at a surperb price!
customer_reviews.text: Very well crafted and was delivered with excellent packing protection and a great case. I have been looking for an electric violin which I could use for (relatively silent practice). This is an excellent choice. It is 4/4 proportion, full size, and I found I could play it right out of the package, although I intend to adjust the action a bit, but, for the price, I would expect that I would have to do some work adjusting to any player's personal preferences. I like the fact that they have left me plenty of room for adjustments! I had no difficulties using the provided headphones or electronics and for me, I've extremely happy with the results and product!
customer_reviews.author: RfhenWulf

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner/intermediate violin
customer_reviews.text: I bought this just over a year ago, not knowing how to play violin, and can now improv decently. To be fair, I am a multi-instrumentalist and can now pick up instruments quickly with moderate practice. But my experience aside, this is a great beginner (and even intermediate) violin and the electric output lends itself nicely to home recording. Very impressed with the violin, but I would suggest getting new strings, a new bow, and use any other pair of headphones that you own, I assure you they will be more comfortable than the ones that come with it.
customer_reviews.author: CKirk

customer_reviews.title: Four years later, still holding strong
customer_reviews.text: At this price point there's nothing to complain about. No major issues after four years of ownership with on and off playing. But if I were to nitpick: - shoulder rest comes loose easily. Not a big deal, just keep a paperclip to tighten now and then - bow is cheap. Replaced it with a carbon fiber to match the black and it still comes under $200 total - black finish colored my fingertips for the first few months. Slightly irritating but no longer an issue
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality and ’gig-able’
customer_reviews.text: It’s ok..If you know how to play a violin then you should be satisfied with it.. def have to use some sand paper to break the surface of the rosin...aldo, you could gig with it i think.. i would feel ok playing a few parts live with it as a fiddle though i’m still getting used to playing it.. i find that focussing more on the bowing aspects of playing help to eliminate squeaky sounds (if you play guitar already then its easy to overlook the bowing mishaps —due to the arch of the bridge which differs from guitar that will cause everything to sound bad if errors happen)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NONE of the "ebony fittings" are ebony. This is blatant FALSE ADVERTISING
customer_reviews.text: Absolute FALSE ADVERTISING! "...with ebony fingerboard, pegs, chin rest and tailpiece" None of these parts are ebony. I bought this one instead of the even cheaper ones available because it is advertised as "ebony fittings"
customer_reviews.author: Odd Pocket

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Starter Electric Violin
customer_reviews.text: I got this violin as a gift for my lady, and she simply loves it. Easy to play, good sound and very stylish. As usual, the headphones are not worth much, but with a better pair of headphones, it's all good. The case is VERY nice. The whole setup is well worth the investment. This instrument inspires curiosity as to how good these electric violins get. We'll see where it goes, as for now, we're ready to plug this into an effects processor and destroy our speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Syntheus

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for students or traveling
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely not a bad purchase for the price! If you're looking for a student instrument or something you can take out and about with you for some quiet practice, this is the violin for you! It came with everything offered - a sturdy case, a bow, rosin, headphones, a cable to hook it up to an amp, a 9v battery, and of course the violin. Mine came in perfect condition! No scratches or dings. My only "concern" is that the mahogany color is very, very red. I'd say it's even a cherry red. It doesn't quite match the picture, but it's still not a bad color.
customer_reviews.author: J. Totten

customer_reviews.title: Great Violin.  I recomend it.
customer_reviews.text: My Daughter loves her new electric violin. Took it to the music store for restring and a professionals review. Dept manager said it was a great buy for the price. They restrung it for me with a nice set of better strings they also recommended replacing the bridge with a better wood piece for the one it came with was very cheap. they rosined the bow and played it through the amp and it sounded awesome. store manager played a 2k Yamaha afterwards and although you could tell the difference the Cecilio violin sounded better in my opinion better tone by far.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Malacara

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my grandson. We always open gifts at my house on Christmas eve and then his family opens gifts at their own house on Christmas morning. He had to be encouraged to come and open gifts because he was busy playing his new violin. He is 13 years old. I think that's about as good a recommendation as you could ever get.
customer_reviews.author: Suzie Einstein

customer_reviews.title: Not ideal
customer_reviews.text: Not a music teacher's ideal student instrument. It's ONLY silent, not silent AND acoustic. Beginners will not get the joy of the full sound. Even with using the headphones at max volume, my child complained about not hearing or barely hearing. On the other hand, it's a nice inexpensive start when one is not sure how committed the learner will be. If getting this for an advanced or semi-pro, stick with Yamaha's silent version
customer_reviews.author: international shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for beginners
customer_reviews.text: A great beginner’s violin, but do not try to tune it yourself unless you know what you’re doing and how to fix a broken string. I’d just taken mine out of the box and barely turned the tuning peg when one of the loose strings popped. I got it restringed and fixed at guitar center and now it works great. The string thing is the only thing holding back from a 5-star, but for the price you cannot expect that it will be absolutely perfect after shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Mackenzie Inman

customer_reviews.title: Not “silent”, but close
customer_reviews.text: It’s billed as silent... and I’m not that disappointed as I figured it wouldn’t be. It’s quiet... but not silent. It’s audio level is about the same as a muted violin. Nice Case but no room for music Came with Rosen and Headphones Has Fine tuning pegs Overall good build quality
customer_reviews.author: adam

customer_reviews.title: Great value. Very pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.text: Everything arrived in excellent condition. Pleasantly surprised that such an inexpensive instrument can look and perform so well. Quality construction apparent throughout, and even the fine-tuners work really well. Especially surprising, the supposedly 'cheap beginners bow' is flawless, finely crafted, with attractive mother-of-pearl inlays matching those on the fiddle, and has the look and feel of a much more expensive bow. Couldn't be more pleased with this purchase. Now I just need to 'practice, practice' so I can find my way to Carnegie Hall.
customer_reviews.author: analogman

customer_reviews.title: A Poetic Review...
customer_reviews.text: There are few words to express the beauty and feel of holding this violin and hearing it after using the amber resin. my mind shifted even swam to the surface of surprise as I endearingly conformed my ears to its wonderful melodic embrace ! I have yet to use it with an amp and only can I imagine the three dimensional sound that will waken my tired heart from its slumber - thank you !
customer_reviews.author: The Hallelujahman !

customer_reviews.title: No good! The computer chip goes out or burns up ...
customer_reviews.text: No good! The computer chip goes out or burns up in 1-3 months, depending on how much you play it. My second one just went out after 3 months and the first just after 1 month. These things are made to burn up! Big waste of money and time on Chinese junk!
customer_reviews.author: RSP

customer_reviews.title: Practice in quiet then turn up the amp
customer_reviews.text: Granddaughter plays at a high level. Hard to practice in small apartment. Now she can practice without everyone hearing so is practicing more. Plugged he into my amp with guitar effects and the sound was amazing. Now playing her classical but adding a bit of country playing along with guitar players
customer_reviews.author: ASN

customer_reviews.title: Loving it (but I think mines amp is broken)
customer_reviews.text: Love it so far. However I think the amp on mine is bad. The headphones only work when the volume is at 9-10. Below that they cut out. And the plug has to be in the right spot or you only get left sound, no right. And it doesn't matter what headphones I'm using. Tried multiple pairs. Gonna check with support and see what they say. Also the rosin that came with it was completely shattered and unusable. Had to order a new one. I still love it and can't wait to learn to make it sound good. Love that's it isn't loud and I can practice all I want without death threats from the hubby or neighbors. 😉
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible sound resonance
customer_reviews.text: For the price this would be a good instrument to get started if the electronics were not so cheap. The resonance created when stroking with repeated movements amplifies too high for the electronics to even record what is happening. I tried to request a refund but the support for this product is terrible. Based on other reviews, I guess it is a hit or miss on whether you will get a faulty model or not. Not happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Kee

customer_reviews.title: cute!!! i would say yes and no for beginners
customer_reviews.text: You don't have to buy new strings for this if your starting out. i bought strings cause i didn't know if these would sound bad, got it tuned and she sounds amazing!!!! Sadly she chips a little. The violin is worth the money if you don't wanna spend more than 200. Still trying to get a hang of this. Yes you can put stickers on the violin, it doesn't change the sound at all. I plan on adding gold leaf to make it look more ornamental. Will update more later (and pics too)
customer_reviews.author: merana haven

customer_reviews.title: Avoid.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give this a good rating, I really do. The sound is fine, the feeling of the instrument is fine, but this photo is what happens after merly 15 minutes of playing. The fret black is covering my fingers. This is the only item I've ever returned on Amazon and I'm sad to have to do that.
customer_reviews.author: David G. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Bad violin
customer_reviews.text: I have played the violin for 50 years. Recently, my kids bought me an electric one for father's day. I use it more that my acoustic/classical violin. So, I thought of purchasing this one for use during my break at work. What an awful sound! No matter your level, do not expose yourself to such abomination.
customer_reviews.author: roussce

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound for the Price
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 10 year old who has been playing violin for three years. She loves it! It sounds really cool (we hooked it up to our son's Roland Micro Cube and it worked really well but you have to have batteries in the violin to get the pick up to work and their isn't a plug for it). We read reviews that said it sounded shrill and scratchy and the pick up was not very good, but it sounds fine to her and her violin teacher (the distortion was fun to play with) so honestly for $100 this is a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: CAS

customer_reviews.title: Dead and cracked... twice!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could have a quiet violin to practice on at night. I realize for the price that this isn’t going to be high quality - but the fact that it won’t even power on and it is cracked defeats the purpose entirely. UPDATE: I ordered this again and it’s still won’t power on! Seriously before you send out a product you could at least make sure that it will turn on. 0 stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: SMetz

customer_reviews.title: About what you would expect.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly it’s cheap. I have bought several cecilio instruments and they seem to be pretty good for a beginner. It’s a myth to say you have to start out with something expensive. 3 months after buying a bow began to develop in the neck rendering the E string relatively unplayable. I sanded down the warping with some extra fine sandpaper and it’s fine again. Not a gorgeous sound but it’s good for practice and designed to be run through effects.
customer_reviews.author: J.Stansted

customer_reviews.title: Excited
customer_reviews.text: So far everything is great except for the case. It is very cheap and my suggestion would to buy one in advance especially if you are traveling with it. The very first time I trip to unzip the pocket, the zipper broke. I just bought it so I was being extremely gentle, as most people are with new things, and with hardly any pressure the zipper snapped.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really nice beginner violin
customer_reviews.text: Incredible for only $120. The sound is better than my acoustic which cost twice as much. I was impressed with the sound quality from the electrics considering I only have it plugged into a small travel amp I bought for my electric uke. I didn't even need to replace the strings with nicer ones.
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: Very good instrument
customer_reviews.text: Great to learn on, without bothering other people. Violin is of good quality and looks great. The only complaint was the bow. My suggestion would be to buy a quality bow as soon as possible. Overall I am very happy with my Cecilio electric violin.
customer_reviews.author: Frank B.

customer_reviews.title: Black paint stains on my fingers and hand. Neck feels thick.
customer_reviews.text: The sound is not great. I upgraded the tailpiece with a Wittner and put better strings than it came with, and if feels better. Its good for practicing when everyone else is asleep. The neck is a lot thicker than my good violin but I'm getting used to it. Even though I wipe it down every time it still stains my fingers black (I bought the black one)
customer_reviews.author: Keith Stevens

customer_reviews.title: I love the look of this instrument and the sound is ...
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of this instrument and the sound is not bad. It is a little heavy compared to my regular violin. I feel like I got a lot for the money. It is not the best quality electric violin or case but it sure is fun to try out an electric instrument. The shape is very attractive and I love all the color options. I have had no trouble with the headphones or cable attachment.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine Susie

customer_reviews.title: Near-professional quality instrument, case, and accessories
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an inexpensive student violin for my daughter to start learning on, but this isn't just a cheap practice instrument: I can easily imagine using it for performances. It came in an amazingly nice case, with all the accessories she needed to get started. Everyone especially appreciates the "silent mode" for practicing, but she can hear the instrument just fine through the included earbuds. Amazing value for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Kim Beall

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase exactly came as it was advertised.
customer_reviews.text: It's a very good product for anyone but the sound is 3rd octave instead of 4th octave but once you get used to it, it sounds pretty good. Setting aside other finances like buying a speaker because I personally wouldn't recommend the heaphones it's a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Needs a speaker and reverb pedal for sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: It sounds...yeah. well it's very quiet compared to a regular violin but if you're not plugged in you might think you're flat. However, with the right pedal, some reverb, and a nice speaker it sounds really awesome. So it's one of those what you put in you get out situations.
customer_reviews.author: Jezabel

customer_reviews.title: My daughter is thoroughly enjoying it and easily transitions between this and her many times more expensive ...
customer_reviews.text: We returned the first after a battery polarity reversal fatally fried it. The 9 V transistor battery could be connected either way with fain indicators of + and -. The replacement came promptly with no problems (thanks Amazon!) with a different battery connector too. My daughter is thoroughly enjoying it and easily transitions between this and her many times more expensive traditional violin. Today she plays the electric in church and the traditional at a wedding.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Jackson

customer_reviews.title: For the price its quite good. Only advice is replace the bridge
customer_reviews.text: For the price its quite good. Only advice is replace the bridge, the bridge is shaped like it was cut by a blind man (in my case at least) so buy yourself a decent bridge, I got a Teller Germany, and it will make playing far better the stings will be spaced properly and it will carry sound better especially on the high e string in my case. The bow is functional but I'd get a better one once you get tired of it because its nothing special. All in all for the price its not bad and you certainly get your moneys worth.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony F.

customer_reviews.title: Use headphones through AMP
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this and I was very happy with it. The only issue I had was that I was hearing a lot of interference through the headphones. I had the electronics replaced and it really didn't do much. I am still super thrilled with this purchase, but to avoid the interference in the headphones I just plug the violin into the amp and plug my headphones into the amp instead of plugging the headphones into the headphone jack on the violin directly. Works great, crystal clear.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: It is not the best electric violin
customer_reviews.text: But it is one of the best beginners electric violin. The price and value is awesome, the sound quality expected with this price range is okay. But if you are a beginner then definitely worth getting it.
customer_reviews.author: Berk

customer_reviews.title: Really nice practice instrument
customer_reviews.text: This is very nice, especially for the price. Workmanship is surprisingly good. The electronics are quiet and give a clear, musical tone. I compared the included bow with a CodaBow Conservatory. The included bow is harder to draw straight, but has a nicer tone. It's definitely good enough to experiment with and to use as a backup for practicing while my bow is in the shop. It's quiet enough that my neighbors in adjacent apartments don't hear. But bear in mind that silent violins are not actually silent. They are a bit more quiet than a regular violin with a brass practice mute. I've played it for about 10 hours so far and the battery is still strong.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Graham

customer_reviews.title: Very cute and awesome instrument ♥
customer_reviews.text: The violin is a success, is my first instrument that I buy for myself, is very good for beginners, although you need an amp so you can her the electric sound of the violin, but from there is good to practice because no matter how high up the sound is without the amp you will never disturb your neighbors sleeping xD
customer_reviews.author: Enya

customer_reviews.title: Pretty chic
customer_reviews.text: For everyone giving this a one star review, you should not buy violins. Granted the headphones are not great, so substitute your own in. If the strings won't vibrate, actually rosin your bow. If you complain about the rosin, you don't know good rosin if it hit you in the face (as the hockey puck rosin is always good rosin). Saying it isn't silent when it makes minimal sound, you're being ridiculous. I have 2 mutes on my traditional violin, and it's still louder than this thing. It's light, durable and just a nice looking instrument. It's a classy compared to other electric violins that are horrendous looking. I haven't played it much, but it has a very nice timbre.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Darcy

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Violin
customer_reviews.text: Sounds exactly like you would expect a 130 dollar violin to sound. Not great, but not too bad. A new set of strings + a better bow would make it sound great. The pegs initially appeared not stay in place, however after a while they eventually settled. If you're expecting a quiet professional sounding violin you will be disappointed. However if you're looking for a starting instrument that won't disturb your apartment neighbors , this is a very good pick.
customer_reviews.author: cinamaldehyde

customer_reviews.title: i have a nice real violin so the quality of this was like ...
customer_reviews.text: i have a nice real violin so the quality of this was like revisiting middle school rental violin. I have a great guitar amp so that's not the issue. but its cheap and works so there you go
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: It's a great instrument for silent practice
customer_reviews.text: It's a great instrument for silent practice. Running it through an Amplifer with a bit of reverb can bring it near to sounding very good. I use this a great deal for early morning practice and writing. It's worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: very pleased with the product
customer_reviews.text: I am Jack of many musical instruments, but master of none. I use a fiddle for some background in my recordings. I have struggled with trying to record an acoustic. I was told there is no good solution beyond using a good microphone. This Cecilio works for me. The instrument comes in a nice gig bag
customer_reviews.author: port hog

customer_reviews.title: rather than light rosin like it says
customer_reviews.text: It arrives VERY out of tune (D-String playing a G, E-String playing an F, etc.) so if you don't know how to tune a violin and you're self-teaching, find a university student or high school student and pay them $5-$10 to tune it. It comes with dark rosin, rather than light rosin like it says. I don't mind, but some people mind. The headphones aren't the best quality, but what do you expect? Overall, it's a good starter violin, as long as you can get it into tune.
customer_reviews.author: Marny Lundy

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased with this violin
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this violin. It arrived on time and in perfect condition. It is a great instrument, and a delight to play. I am also very pleased with most of the accessories that accompanied it. The interior of the case is a beautiful light blue color that matches the violin. The bow is also nice. The headphones are a little on the not-so-great side, but are really the least-important part of this kit. Terrific violin, good bow, and nifty case. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Very nice violin for the price. I bought it to learn how to play so can’t really evaluate it too thoroughly but I do feel I made a good choice
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The CEVN-2 is not a toy.  It is built for serious players.
customer_reviews.text: The instrument is well built with quality hardware. It sounds awesome through a guitar amplifier. For the cost it punches way above it's weight class. The headphones are super cheap but they work. The amp cable seems tiny and frail to me, not like an electric guitar cable. But it's not a guitar, so the cable may be as good as it gets without a wireless blue-tooth connection device.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Askwig

customer_reviews.title: I really like the instrument
customer_reviews.text: I really like the instrument. I bought it because I'm new to the violin and wanted an instrument that would still be worth having once (if) I upgraded to a proper student fiddle. I really enjoy it. The bow is a bit warped and I wish it wasn't. That's why it's not 4 or 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Put some nice strings on it and the sound quality isn't too ...
customer_reviews.text: Still jam on this guy three years later! Put some nice strings on it and the sound quality isn't too bad. For the price, great start-up e-violin!
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Great Student Violin
customer_reviews.text: Overall I am very pleased with the violin. Out of the box it was reasonably tunable and the tuning pegs seem to be holding well. The violin itself is well made and the very minor cosmetic imperfections are easy to overlook. The weight and feel of the instrument are balanced and were easy to get used to. Some solid body electric violins can be heavy but with all the "cutouts" on this model it is nice and light. The headphones and the bow are nothing to write home about, but they will get you started. This will be a fun instrument for me to practice quietly from another room while my family sleeps, and learn the attributes of electric music!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great violin for the price. I am playing Mozart Violin Concerto no.3 on it for fun. I am a casual player, intermediate level. Holds a tune after the strings have a proper time to stretch out.
customer_reviews.author: Legato Bluesummers

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but quiet enough for night owls in small apartments
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for practicing and learning in a small apartment where silence is key. This violin is cheap and sounds electric no matter what you do, but it is quiet enough to be used at 2am and not piss people off. I do recommend getting a good set of strings for it as the ones it comes with are garbage. The bow it comes with is pretty sketchy too and the hair is not likely to stay in very long. The rosin should be flushed down the toilet.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Higgs

customer_reviews.title: best electric violin out there for the money A+
customer_reviews.text: I bought a cheaper electric first and it was a nightmare, from the moment I opened the case I could tell the quality was there, did very little setup on it and it was a far superior instrument and sounded awesome dont mess with others that are cheaper or claim to be better, cecilio is a great violin company, your money wont be wasted on these violins
customer_reviews.author: rocky

customer_reviews.title: A bit disappointed
customer_reviews.text: So the violin looks visually nice, however the bow was broken, missing two strings, Missing rosin, and the headphones obviously are horrible It’s a bit of a disappointment to wait on a package and have items be broke
customer_reviews.author: Tamika Barlow

customer_reviews.title: Review after a month of owning!! :)
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful, I have had no issue with mine. Have owned it for over a month now. I wanted to pick up violin again (have played for 12 years). I didn't want to buy an expensive violin until I get better but I was actually delightfully surprised that it's a really nice product. Thanks Cecilio!!
customer_reviews.author: Haunted_Shores

customer_reviews.title: blue is my favorite color but the black looked great too
customer_reviews.text: The first thing l want to say is the design captured my attention immediately. Being a person who plays the violin, l was excited to play a electric violin, blue is my favorite color but the black looked great too. When l played the violin it exceeded my expectations. It was great being able to play and not disturb anyone else with the head phones. I ended up buying two.
customer_reviews.author: DONALD VANN

customer_reviews.title: The violin came in good condition and everything
customer_reviews.text: The violin came in good condition and everything, only problem is the rosin, it came all broken and in little pieces and power and rosin pieces was outside the box everywhere. also the strings on the bow kept falling apart, about 4 strings from the bow came out, the peg wont stay in it keeps slipping out and wont stay it when i try to tune it. Hopefully when i take it to a pro they can keep the peg to stay in, trade a bow with me. Other than that its perfect! Sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: Briana Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Very cool and sounds awesome!
customer_reviews.text: For the money this is awesome I bought this for my sister and she loves it It is one of the best and good quality close to the once you buy for couple grands . I highly recommend it, give it a try!
customer_reviews.author: Dany

customer_reviews.title: Solid Wood and a solid instrument
customer_reviews.text: I am new to the violin, but I am familiar with several other instruments. This violin has a good sound and comes with everything necessary for any beginner or seasoned professional. Very sturdy construction, with a sportscar finish. Despite the good quality of the instrument and accessories, the bow leaves much to desire. The tone is somewhat inconsistent and scratchy. Also, the violin is not silent. It is much quieter than an acoustic violin, but not silent. However, the Ceciilio is a great deal for anyone interested in getting to know electric string instruments.
customer_reviews.author: J. P.

customer_reviews.title: The volume doesn't work. I tried the headphones they ...
customer_reviews.text: The volume doesn't work. I tried the headphones they sent and a pair of $200 headphones, but the only time there was even a change in the sound was when it was turned all the way up. And even that "high" setting wasn't more than a regular metzo forte when playing an acoustic violin.
customer_reviews.author: David Alan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Beginner Instrument
customer_reviews.text: Feels a little different than an acoustic one but easy to get used to. Can play with or without headphones. Light.
customer_reviews.author: J. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: My music player in my family absolutely loves it. Now they can practice without disturbing others around them. It looks like no other violin you may find and they like unique things. So great buy! I am very pleased with the violin and they ship it quickly too! Thank you and I highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Landgren

customer_reviews.title: Nice violin.
customer_reviews.text: Sound was a little loud. Bow was sturdy and didn't break. Toon me 4 hours to tune do to humidity. Overall good quality for beginners and intermediate violinists. Pain job had a few blemishes.
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: My Daughter Love It, But 1 string was broke...The seller is going to send some, but very happy overall!!!
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: Looks cool from about 3 feet away
customer_reviews.text: Well, if you don't mind replacing all the tuning pegs so that it holds it tune then this is ok. Looks cool from about 3 feet away, but not up close and personal. Then again, for the price, I can't complain too much. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Mom in big D

customer_reviews.title: In his violin is good for its price range but there are some defect ...
customer_reviews.text: In his violin is good for its price range but there are some defect that Cecilio could have corrected. the saddle is too high which makes the game difficult, traces of glue are really visible in some places and the helmet is simply unusable, the ankles do not hold well ok I would advise to change them by wittner fine tune . if not the violin gives a good sound quality I'm not disappointed with this rating the
customer_reviews.author: Jacques KONGOLO LWELA

customer_reviews.title: Great overall, but........
customer_reviews.text: The violin is great. Everything about it is great. The only downside is false labeling and a string problem. The false labeling is that the product states that it is silent, but it is not. I could be wrong and do not know how to make it silent. But as of the moment, I believe it is false labeling. Once I received my product, it was all great until I tried the G string. The string was all loose, it would not tighten at all. it took a while until I finally managed to keep it tightened. But overall, the product is great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Paying for the violin everything else is cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: The violin itself is nice the headphones are cheap and so is the bow. The rosin is horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Alethea S.

customer_reviews.title: Pain in butt to return and a waste of time
customer_reviews.text: Arrived broke. Pain in butt to return and a waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: T Family

customer_reviews.title: Would not tune properly
customer_reviews.text: The violin looks beautiful and cane with everything you need to get started playing, however tuning it was next to impossible. No matter what I did, the A string would not tune right. The violin went back to seller.
customer_reviews.author: TADWOLF

customer_reviews.title: Great semi-professional use
customer_reviews.text: Really impressed as a violin teacher & prof musician i needed a beat-about instrument to take with me everywhere! I have an amp as well well as a pre-amp and the volume if great for electronic performance.
customer_reviews.author: K.C. White

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Good Quality, If you know how to play violin then this is just right. The bow is not the best quality, and the headphones are trash, but everything else is perfect for the price. I have wanted an electric violin for a very long time. Finally bought this wooden beauty and am completely beside myself. Note: The pickup does seem a bit on the cheap side-- maybe not the pickup itself but the connection, we will see as time goes on.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Caspar

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t advise
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not for beginners, 2 units had no sound at all coming from them.
customer_reviews.author: keka17

customer_reviews.title: Good violin, not so good kit
customer_reviews.text: Great violin for silent practicing. The head phones are not so great, recommend buying a better pair and also might want to spring for a better bow. The violin itself is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: DavidDavidB

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son. When I first opened it I thought it was broke, I did not see the item when I ordered it. My kids put things in the cart they wanted for Christmas and I just ordered the cart. Plays well and with the looks of it, it quite the conversation piece.
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth Goodhue

customer_reviews.title: Ceciillo is a lie
customer_reviews.text: I was looking at electric cellos then this came up in related items, it was half the price of the others. So I thought "dang what a great deal" turns out that even though ceciillo sounds like it would manufactur cellos it was all a rouse and I bought an electric violin. 0/10 stars would not buy again...
customer_reviews.author: Casey Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Peg loosening problem
customer_reviews.text: Its a very beautiful violin however receiving mine the pegs were really loose. I had tuned my violin and not even 30 min into playing i had to retune it cause the pegs kept coming loose. I pushed them in more to keep them from loosening but it doesnt seem to stay very well.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Pika Chick

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to satiate your "passion" of owning a electric violin for the given price!
customer_reviews.text: Well to begin with - I am not a pro...though I play decent classical violin and have learnt (and am still learning) for over 7-8 years! This purchase of a beginner-electric violin was to satisfy my "passion" of owning and playing an electric violin and I must say - this serves much more than that purpose... Connected to a decent Amp, it gives you all the "kick" you need to enjoy a decent violin with the electric punch...I am more than satisfied with the quality, service, delivery, packaging and all the things that came with the kit for the small price that it had!
customer_reviews.author: Shekar Hariharan

customer_reviews.title: Highly disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was sent a fake electric Violin....I was excited to finally receive it and right when i was about to insert the battery i realized it was a fake battery port. Highly disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Anthony S Rim

customer_reviews.title: I love this violin
customer_reviews.text: Ok so ive had this violin for about 3 months now and all i can say is that its awesome. This is my second violin and i think it's great for an intermediate player.
customer_reviews.author: Cephalon owl

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great violin. Quiet enough to not disturb anyone and loud enough for you to hear it. THIS VIOLIN WILL NEED NEW STRINGS. When I first tried tuning the strings they each broke- one by one, every single one of them. Why do I still give this 5 stars? Because for the price this violin is still amazing. Once I got the new strings and a better bow, I was good to go. It works amazingly and stays in tune for weeks. Awesome product. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: It increases daughter's desire to play.
customer_reviews.text: Tired of lugging her violin back and forth to school we looked into a back-up option. Everything works as advertised. This thing is awesome. We pump the audio through my guitar amp and effects and the daughter is having so much fun with it that she practices so much more now. Set-up takes a tiny amount of skill. The bridge needs to be placed and the strings tuned. The pegs hold well and the fine-adjusters have given me no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: I loved it
customer_reviews.text: Its great. Its not too loud without amplifier. The only problem was that the headphones didn't work that well.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Completely playable out of the case. Better then expected
customer_reviews.text: Overall better than I expected. Neck angle is good the action (string height to fingerboard) was fine. The scale length was a little longer the 3/4 my daughter plays but shorter then 4/4. The bridge needs to be moved up and one of the fine tuners was missing a screw. For cheap electric violin for practice I think it is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: dereck perkins

customer_reviews.title: Pleased violinist's mom
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has been playing violin for several years now and really wanted an electric violin. This was an inexpensive option for me and it works great. She can't play it at school, but really enjoys playing at home.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy & Jeff P.

customer_reviews.title: This violin is pretty solid for the price
customer_reviews.text: This violin is pretty solid for the price. When I was looking for an electric violin, I was looking for something that: 1. was a fairly reasonable price 2. looked cool And this violin definitely met those criteria. I've only been playing with it for a little over a month now, but the sound seems pretty solid. The fret board is nice and smooth. The tuners keep everything nice and tuned, even after long jam sessions. Overall, I liked the violin.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: It's great good for beginners, but it should not be your fist violin. And the headphones is comes with are crap. But other than that I love it, it great for the price!!!
customer_reviews.author: Naomi

customer_reviews.title: Good value. You loose out on the benefits of ...
customer_reviews.text: Good value. You loose out on the benefits of working with a music store, but savings is the trade off. If you have enough knowledge to get it set up yourself the savings may make it worthwhile. The bow and headphones are cheap, and we immediately replaced the strings. The value is in the violin and case, and the opportunity to play with an electric violin without spending a fortune.
customer_reviews.author: busybee

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I hoped for
customer_reviews.text: This violin is a great buy. Everything works well and the tone is nice. I purchased this violin to carry with me when traveling. I may have to leave it in the car some days when it is hot, this is why I am glad the violin is in good working order but the finish is a bit rough. I don't feel any remorse about leaving the instrument in a hot car. I must say that if a little more time and attention to detail had been spent in the finishing of the instrument, it could easily sell for twice the price. I hope this review helps someone.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: I replaced the old tailpiece and it seems to be working fine now. The pegs keep slipping
customer_reviews.text: Ok so I got this thing and it worked for a little while but then the tailpiece kept snapping off whenever I tried to tune it. Because it couldn't handle the tension. So I left feedback saying how awful it was and they emailed me- we corresponded a bit and eventually they ended up just sending me a new tailpiece. I replaced the old tailpiece and it seems to be working fine now. The pegs keep slipping, so it's not technically in tune, but all the strings seem to remain 1/5th apart so it's playable (just not with other people who are tuned properly).
customer_reviews.author: Jolyn

customer_reviews.title: Nice but must tune all the time.
customer_reviews.text: Nice overall but attaching the bridge and tuning it was a pain. Took about an hour because broke one of the strings while tuning. Glad my daughter had extras from her other violins. She says she has to tune it more than her other violins before every use.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

product_meta.title: Cecilio CEVN-2BK Style 2 Silent Electric Solid Wood Violin with Ebony Fittings in Metallic Black, Size 4/4 (Full Size)
product_meta.description: Size:full-size| Color:Metallic BlackWhether you're practicing, recording in studio or performing on stage, the Cecilio electric violin outfit offers excellent functionality and style. It provides violinists of all levels with the ability to practice confidently without disturbing others. The outfit features a 1/8" output jack that allows you to connect to most guitar amps or PA systems (1/4" to 1/8" cable included), volume control that allow you to choose the ambience you want, headphone jack for practice and a line-in jack for practice with a background track. This violin package includes a well-padded lightweight hard case, a bow, rosin, bridge, pickup, aux cable, and headphones. Great for Student, Intermediate and Professional Violinist.
feature_bullets: Size 4/4, style 2 electric / silent violin in metallic black varnish (full size)
Hand-carved solid maple wood body with ebony fingerboard, pegs, chin rest and tailpiece with 4 detachable nickel plated fine tuners
Includes: lightweight hard case, Brazil wood bow with unbleached genuine Mongolian horsehair, quality rosin cake, a bridge, aux cable, and headphones

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars784 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
